comm: slight swing back in, starts around middle and leg, worked away for a single to fine leg
shape back in again, from around middle and off, and hits the inside half of the bat
hits the inside half of the bat again, but this time Sarkar has managed to push it wide of mid-on for one
on a length, on off, holds its line, Tamim gets a stride in and defends
gives him the charge. It was a matter of when with Tamim facing Bhuvneshwar, and not when. Bhuvneshwar shortens the length this time, and draws an inside edge, but concedes three runs to fine leg
short of a length, on the pads, turned away to square leg
Tamim charges Yadav this time, who bowls short and squeezes under the pull of Tamim
on a length, on off, going with the angle, and left alone
short of a length, wide, punched away to square third man for one
slightly short of a length, Sarkar looks to pull, but is beaten. Just swings over the ball
nicely played. This is a length ball, on off, he pushes at it with an open face but close to his body. Places it wide of cover for two
fuller, no room, defended back to him
on a length, on middle and off, defended towards mid-on. Hang on. He has overstepped
bounces him with the free hit, and it bouncer over the bat as Tamim hooks
shimmies down, defends a length ball towards cover
short of a length, tucked away off the hip
pushed on the up, nicely timed. Kohli's dive to his left, from wide mid-off, gets a hand to it, but the ball still hurtles along to the fence
short of a length, pitches middle and leg, defended with an open face
on a length, on the pads, finds square leg with his flick
short, no sting in it, pulled away from under chest high, but a dive at short fine leg keeps them to on
on the up and over the top. A length ball, around off, angling away, and he throws his arms through it, lofting it over cover
on the pads, and clipped away to deep square leg
looking to leave this alone but makes the decision late, and ends up playing at it with an open face. Yet so easy paced is the pitch that this doesn't trouble him
tucked away off the pad for one
short of a length, no room, defended from the crease
on a length, around off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, BK bowls short of a length while not giving him any room. Tamim pushes this to mid-off on the run, and charges through to complete the single
Rayudu, already on the field as a substitute, puts in a dive at the square-leg boundary as Sarkar clips this off the pads. The save is clean and Rayudu is plus two on the fielding score sheet
pushed to mid-off on the up
Bhuvneshwar tries the bouncer, but goes too high and is wided
flicks away a length ball over the infield, gets a single to deep square leg
on a length, on the pads, he presses forward and drops it into the leg side for one
draws an edge as he pushes a length ball across Tamim, but it falls short of Dhawan at wide first slip, and squeezes under his hands for four runs
dances down the wicket, reaches the pitch of a length ball, and drives it with an open face, over point. That is an audacious shot
down the wicket again, Yadav bowls short this time and beats his slash
solid front-foot defensive
half tracker. Easy-paced pitch. Meat and drink. Tamim pulls off the front foot, between the bowler and mid-on

three fours and a six this over. Tamim is dancing down to the Indian quicks reprising his assault at Zaheer Khan in the 2007 World Cup. Goes over cover this time, and he has put enough muscle behind this to send it over the rope
short of a length, on off, punched away on the up, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, flicked away off the hip, uppishly towards deep midwicket for one
short, chest high, pulled away along the ground for one

smashed away. No respect. Pure audacity. This is a gentle length ball, pitches middle, angles away. Does nothing else. No movement, no disconcerting bounce. Sarkar stands tall, swipes it across the line, and sends it over a wide mid-on
a length ball angles in, and is defended back
gentle short ball, and despite its rising shoulder high Sarkar has pulled this to deep midwicket for four more easy runs
short and wide down the leg side. A really ordinary loosener from Ashwin
really slow in the air, Tamim is through with his premeditated sweep by the time the ball arrives. He is lucky this hasn't lobbed off the glove
short of a length again, worked into the leg side for one
lovely cover-drive. This is a decent offbreak. Flighted nicely, not half-volley, driven through extra cover for four. All along the4 ground
natural variation. No turn on this offbreak, hits the inside edge onto the pad
ordinary bowling. Fired into the pads with only leg slip fielding behind the wicket on the leg side. Sarkar gets enough bat on the sweep to send it past that man
tucked away into the leg side for another single

Bangladesh showing no respect to the World Cup semi-finalists. Sarkar charges at him first ball, and even though the bowler has shortened the length he goes ahead with the thump, sending this past midwicket for four
slower ball, he is waiting for it, and opens the face to get a single to third man
pushed to mid-off, and Raina prevents the single
down the wicket, Mohit bowls short of a length, cramps him up, draws a dot
Outside the crease. Inside the crease. Doesn't matter. A length ball, he gets under it, and lofts it over mid-off
down the wicket again, mis-hits this to mid-off, which allows him to take a single
slow offbreak, Tamim looks to defend, is hit on the pad first, draws an lbw appeal, but is hit outside the line of off
down the wicket, lofts this down the ground. Long-off is back, which keeps them down to one
lovely stop by Raina. This is a length-ball offbreak. Sarkar stands tall, opens the face, but Raina anticipates it and dives to his right at first slip to get a hand to it and save runs
pushed wide of mid-on for one
tucked around the corner for another single into the leg side
flighted on middle and off, defended off the front foot
offbreak that doesn't turn, makes him react quickly to bring the bat down, and they take a single off the sort-of inside edge
defended to cover
flighted delivery, driven hard, but straight to cover
tossed up, pushed to long-off for one
gets away with it. This is short and wide, but Tamim has hit this straight to point
short of a length, into the pads, defended towards mid-on
tossed up on off, pushed to long-off for an easy single
that's filth. That is short, really short, and slow, and has sat up to be hit. Goes over midwicket for a four
fired into the pads, beats the inside edge or this could be runs
into the pads again, Dhawan makes a diving save at short fine leg
flighted outside off, pushed to cover

another lovely shot. This is incredible batting from Bangladesh. Sarkar is out of the crease, right to the pitch of the ball, which means he can go across the line of it, and lofts it over midwicket for six
desperately ridiculous appeal. This would have been a leg-side wide had it not hit his pad, but India appeal for the lbw. Showing the pressure
worked into the leg side for one
pushed to long-on
down the wicket, realises he is not quite to its pitch, and pads it away
darted into the pads, helped along for one
short of a length, easy single down to long-on

what a way to get to the fifty. Sharma tries to bounce him, Sarkar stays still, stands tall, and ramps this over the keeper's head. Great atmosphere in the stands as he gets a standing ovation. This has the makings of a great day for the crowd
on a length, angling in, defended to cover-point
short of a length, on off, opens the face, gets a single

well bowled. A yorker, but forget it. India have got lucky here. Lucky in that they have been provided a run-out opportunity out of nowhere. Tamim digs it out to leg, there is no single available, but Sarkar sets off. Rightly sent back, but not in time. Raina swoops in, gets an underarm flick in, and catches him short with a direct hit. Lucky that they get the opportunity, skilful in cashing it in
short of a length, on the front foot, uses soft hands to take a single
on a length, angling in, worked into the leg side to get off the mark
flighted outside off, Tamim stretches forward to defend
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, lucky he hasn't got bat to it. Leg-bye conceded nonetheless
flat and full outside off, pushed down the ground, but can't beat short straight extra cover
stays flat again, no room, pushed back to him
tossed up outside off, pushed to long-off
no respite for India. Tamim marches to fifty by dancing down the wicket and lofting this length ball to long-off for four. A no-ball too
bowls it full, really full, but Tamim's bat comes down hard on it, and it bounces over Mohit's head for four through mid-off
length ball, angling in, pushed into the off side for one
short of a length, holds its line outside off to beat his attempt to run this down to third man
this time Das connects with the open face, gets a single to third man

Tamim is out of the crease first ball on resumption. Sharma bowls short, cramps him, the bottom edge comes back to Sharma, who has a mock throw at the batsman, thus drawing derisive cries from the stands
length ball, angling in, worked into the leg side for a single
length ball, angling in, defended back to him
another forward-defensive as Raina tosses it up
on a length, flatter, just outside off, no turn, defended to cover
fuller, still flat, punched to point. Another dot
another dot as he gives no room on a length ball that doesn't turn away
slower through the air but full and on the pads, and is worked into the leg side for one
tossed-up offbreak, driven to long-off
pushed between the stumps and the non-striker for a single

what a concentration break. He was playing so well before the rain break. Then came an over with just one run, and he has thrown it away now. You expect better from one of your best batsmen. He has left the crease and lofted this straight down the throat of long-off. This is not a mis-hit. He has hit this in the direction of the fielder, almost as if he thought the mid-off was up in the circle. To Ashwin's credit, he did cramp Tamim up, but he has worked harder for wickets
chips this offbreak into the off side for a single
full, middle and leg, worked away for a single
slightly short of a length, lets him go back and push this towards deep cover for one
flat, short of a length, stays low, takes the inside edge onto the pad
slower through the air, doesn't turn, gets a soft leading edge
into the pads, worked away to leg
flat, angling in, defended
another defensive shot as Rain stays accurate
slows this one down, the ball not only doesn't turn but also stays low. Somehow he manages to keep it out
offbreak, around off, defended from the crease
slightly short of a length, turning in, helped along to the leg side for a single
short of a length, around off, opens the face, gets a single to short third man

Ashwin strikes again. He has bowled this one superbly. Gets the offbreak to dip, Das thinks he is to pitch of the ball but isn't. He goes ahead with the drive, but Ashwin has created enough separation to turn this back in and hit his pad. Right in front of off he is hit. The ball would have hit middle
flat, angling in, defended off the back foot
flighted on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
short, turning in, cut away for one
full, middle and off, pushed wide of cover for one
short, into the pads, punched away to deep midwicket
full, pushed through, pretty accurate, Shakib defends from the crease
slower through the air, Shakib drives this to long-off for one
slightly short, pulled away, but can't beat the man at square leg
short of a length, punched away to deep cover
tries the slog sweep, is not quite to the pitch of the ball, and is lucky he has not hit in the air to midwicket
flights this one even more, defended on off
quicker, flatter, around off again, defended back to him
another slog sweep, despite having been beaten in the flight. This team he manages to clear midwicket, and takes a single
goes back to a length-ball offbreak and is duly beaten on the cut. Too ambitious a shot
short, rare bad ball. Rahim makes room and cuts it between point and short third
paddles this flat delivery fine of fine leg for a couple
another loose ball from Raina. Short, not too much room, though, and hence he doesn't get enough power behind the cut. Gets a couple
slog sweeps this to deep midwicket for one
full, middle and leg, driven to long-off for one
quick delivery, short of a length, punched down the ground, but can't beat the short straight midwicket
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, opens the face on a shortish ball, and gets a single through an overthrow from Raina at slip
tries the late-cut but the ball doesn't have enough pace on it. Can't beat short third man

Rahim down the wicket, looks for a straight six, but has holed out. Ashwin is on a roll. Bangladesh are imploding. The idea is right, in that he is looking to go straight, but the ball has dipped ever so slightly to pitch out of the zone of a clean swing. The mis-hit settles with Rohit Sharma at straight long-on
slow through the air, teasing him, defended off the front foot
flat delivery, stays back to defend
lovely bowling. Hangs it up in the air, then watches it come down alarmingly. Sabbir is nowhere near its pitch, and is beaten on the outside edge. The ball ricochets off Dhoni's glove for a bye
full, outside off, defended to cover
flat, into the pads, worked to leg, but can't beat the man inside the circle
swept away for a single
fullish, middle and leg, defended towards short straight cover
short, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, around off, he opens the face, but gets it straight to short third man
short of a length, punched towards deep midwicket
beaten on the sweep, draws an lbw appeal. He is hit outside the line, though
stays back to drop this length-ball offbreak into the off side for one
stays back, looks for the turn before opening the face, but the ball goes on  with the arm and cramps him. Shakib manages to keep it out, though
down the wicket, but finds himself away from the pitch of a flighted delivery, and has to defend this back to Ashwin
flatter, quicker, defended back this time
swept away to long leg for one
short, pulled away, straight of deep square leg for four. Now this was a ball that could have been hit without risk, and the shot was on. Not the ones Tamim and Rahim played
drives this full ball to deep cover
another risky shot. Looks to cut what is almost a length ball. Lucky that the bottom edge has not gone onto the stumps
into the pads, and helped around the corner
half-volley, driven to long-off for one
flat, angling in, driven to long-on
nearly bowled him. Sabbir slog-sweeps at a full ball angling in, misses, and is saved by six inches
worked into the leg side, with the angle, gets a single
goes back to look to back-cut, can't find the gap around the point area
darted into the pads, helped around the corner
slower through the air, slight turn, defended off the front foot
angling into the pads, worked away for a single
reverse sweep. Finds the gap. Beats short third man. Pretty sweet connection too. Chose the flat delivery to play the shot to. Good choice
slow, short of a length, worked to leg, but can't beat square leg
action replay of the previous delivery. Looks like an easy single but he has worked it straight to square leg
this time he pushes straight of square leg but Rahane at midwicket is alert
finally gets a single into the leg side, placing this fine of square leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, flat, Jadeja is lucky he has found point with the cut
flat, into the body, hit to midwicket
worked to square leg, with the angle

slog sweep. This time he has picked the right ball. From wider outside off than he previously did. Sabbir thus covers the stumps and gets his body outside the line. And then connects well with the shot
flighted on off, defended, and they steal a single off their feet in the off side
defended back to him
wide down the leg side
signs of reverse as this tails back in to beat the inside edge. Headed down leg, though
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man
down the wicket, Yadav bowls short, draws a mis-hit to cover
long hop, pulled away disdainfully.  Bangladesh getting away again
runs this down to third man
flighted outside off, driven to deep cover
length ball, turning in, defended to midwicket
short, stays low, hence not pulled away for four but for just one
slower through the air, defended to point
swept from in front of the stumps. Beats the men deep on the leg side
flighted just outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, angling across him, beats the open face
short of a length, angling across him, defended to point
dropped into the leg side, comes back for a second, much to the frustration of the man at deep midwicket
good-looking drive, gets a single to deep cover
down the wicket, not to the pitch of it, ends up defending
looks to pull, the ball skids on, draws another dot
slightly short of a length, looks to beat short third but can't

slips out of his hand for a high loopy full toss. Shakib waits for it before hitting him over cover. It is a chest high full toss, and even though it is a loopy one, it is called no-ball. memories of the quarter-final, anybody?
quicker, angling into the pads, defended to leg
swept away from in front of middle, gets a single
on a length, holds its line, defended off the front foot
down the pitch to chip this to deep midwicket
down the wicket again, drives this to long-off for one
short of a length, cut away to third man
short of a length again, can't beat point this time
again he stays short. This time provides him with the width too. And this time Shakib has pierced the gap between cover-point and backward point
Over the wicket. Round the wicket. Long hop filth is long hop filth. Pulled away to deep midwicket for four
fuller finally, worked away for one off the pads
slower ball, and Sabbir has picked this early and slogged him over midwicket for four. Might have been a slower ball, but a half-volley is a half-volley
flat length ball, angling in, defended
on a length, straight, bunted into the leg side for one
short of a length, cut away to deep cover for one

dropped. Technically it is a drop. Shakib is down the wicket and drills it back at Jadeja who sticks out a left hand to deflect it into the body of umpire Tucker. This is going like a bullet, so very difficult to catch
looks to run this behind square off the off side. Can't, as the delivery is too full for the shot
long hop. he misses out as he pulls this straight to midwicket
flighted on off and he jigs down to loft this for a massive six over long-on. Pressure back on immediately
full, outside leg, lucky the paddle sweep has found short fine leg
bunted into the leg side for one
flat length ball, middle and leg, pushed to long-off for one
legbreak, but way outside leg. Called a wide
tossed up outside off, swept away powerfully to deep midwicket
flighted, outside leg, turning back in, swept away to deep backward square leg
slog sweep, but he is not quite to its pitch and finds midwicket with it
beaten in the flight a she dances down the wicket, and gets a couple of a soft inside edge towards deep square leg
flatter, short of a length, he makes room to dab it towards point for one
short and wide, turns away to defeat his shot. Goes to cover as opposed to point

timber. Jadeja strikes. For all his criticism Jadeja has done well today. Sabbir has been looking to slog sweep him. The first one beat him and missed off by six inches. The next one, taken from wide outside off, was connected well and went for four. This, though, was straighter than the first one, and beat Sabbir to hit the off stump. He is one of the tougher bowlers to slog-sweep
flighted on off, driven to long-off
short, easy single for Hossain, to deep midwicket
slower through the air, middle and leg, defended off the front foot
short of a length, he looks to turn this around the corner, but finds short midwicket
flatter, quicker, Shakib dabs on it, but finds cover-point
offbreak, middle and leg, helped to leg for one
short, wide, slow, but he has hit it straight to cover-point. Ashwin gets away with this one
looks for the paddle sweep, gets a massive top edge and clears short fine leg
full, on off, pushed to short straight cover
beautiful shot. Down the wicket, just a little off the pitch of the ball, which allows him room to swing the bat, and crashes this flat over long-off for six
quicker, fired in, defended from the crease
down the wicket again, this time he gets too close to the pitch of the ball, hence drags this towards mid-on, but the man is in the circle, and hence this is an easy four for him
flighted outside off, driven in front of deep cover
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
on a length, outside leg, worked into the leg side for one
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
full outside leg, he is lucky this has not gone past short fine leg as Shakib helps it along
slower ball, dipping low full toss, pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single. Dhoni has snuck one over in for just five runs
short, but doesn't quite come on, which means Shakib can't beat the man at point. Just doesn't get the timing. Has to do with a single
short, but gets stuck in the pitch again. Has to play in front of square for just one
another half-century in this innings. Bunts this shortish ball into the leg side for one. The roof has come off the stadium with the cheer. Imagine if Shakib gets the hundred
finally the short ball gets the treatment. Finally manages to place it square. Beats the desperate Rahane who chases fro0m deep cover
tossed up outside off, pushed to extra cover
down the wicket, Jadeja sees it and shortens the length, draws a defensive shot
makes room to drive this length ball to long-off
stays back to a length ball, pushes this towards cover for one
makes room, Kohli tries to follow him with a slower ball outside leg. Shakib moves back to his orignal stance and draws a wide. Also an extra as Dhoni fails to collect it cleanly
full outside off, pushed past point
makes room again, this time holds his shot and gets just the single to long-off
slower ball, really full, pushed to long-on for one
slower ball, dips on him, outside leg, but Shakib seems to have get some bat on it but not enough to send it anywhere for runs. A dot for Kohli
short of a length, dabbed into the covers for one
misses out on a gift down the leg side. Has to do with a leg-bye
short, wide, run down to third man for one

This is short and wide. Shakib can hit it anywhere b ut he has hit this straight to backward point. Can you believe it? This is not a slower delivery but has stuck in the pitch, which has defeated his shot and made him hit it straight to the fielder
quick length ball, holds its line, beats the outside edge
full and straight, defended back to him
down the leg side, kisses the pad on the way. Gets away with this one
down the wicket, Kumar shortens the length, draws a defensive push from him
slower ball, short of a length, dropped into the leg side for one
punished for a full toss down the leg side. Not literally, though. These are leg-byes so they won't reflect in Kumar's account but four runs for Bangladesh
full, angling in, worked to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, jags in a little to cramp him, defended back to him
swings hard at a quick length ball, ends up slicing it to deep cover for one
short ball, quite quick, surprises him, hits his arm before the hands come up. Hits the helmet too but softly
short, wide, not the smartest delivery, and Hossain cuts it over point for four. The momentum that Bangladesh needed
short and wide again, Yadav is encouraged - it seems - by how the ball got stuck in the pitch when he got Shakib out. This time, though, Hossain punches it in front of square and gets three runs
Mortaza makes room and opens the bat face to place it past point

lovely catch by Jadeja. A full toss, on off, Hossain gets hit high on the bat - nowhere near waist high, though - and the outside edge seems to have lobbed over point. Jadeja runs back, almost over-runs it, but then gets both the hands up, reverse cups, to catch it
strange batting. A full toss on the pads, and he hasn't offered it a shot. Hasn't picked it, I think. Tries to take the leg-bye but the umpire rightly sends him back signalling dead ball
low full toss outside off, Rubel is on a knee and drives it between short third man and point for four. Bangladesh need every run they can get
short of a length, angling in, cramping him up, draws a dot
bouncer, spongy bounce, beats his hook. Close to being called a wide, but isn't

India keep chipping away. Kumar tucks him up with a short-of-a-length delivery with no room. Rubel is mostly a front-foot player, and he is handcuffed here with the ball rising chest high. All he manages is a lob to mid-off
short of a length, angling across him, defended
short of a length, pretty rapid, on  off, and beats Mortaza, who is not fancying getting behind the line of the ball
makes room Yadav follows him, Mortaza is cramped for room but gores ahead with the sbhot. The mis-hit clears mid-on who is inside the circle
slower ball, dropped to leg for one
short of a length, no room, tucks him up. Taskin bunts this to leg for one
makes room, opens the face on a low full toss, steers it to front of third man, and comes back for two
dug in short, he looks to make room to ramp it over the keeper's head, but is beaten. Just too quick for that shot
short ball, mis-hits the pull shot, but it falls safely wide of mid-on and brings Mortaza on strike

another short ball, another mis-hit, and it falls safely in the vacant mid-on region. Mortaza charges back for the second, the throw comes to his end, and Mortaza makes it by inches. This is now Bangladesh's highest total against India
short again, chest high, Mortaza misses on the pull, Dhoni fumbles the collection, they get a bye
dug in short, pretty straight, and beats his pull. The ball is not quite coming on when dug in short
this wicket was a-comin'. Taskin has been frustrated by the short balls. This time he walks down to one, is in no position, and the edge settles with cover

and the debutant shows lack of awareness. This is the last ball of the over, he should know Mortaza will want the single, but he doesn't even move. He is lucky this time that Kohli msifelds running in from midwicket. That's a life. How much will that cost India?
starts off with a slower ball, which beats him and rolls to the keeper. Mortaza through the shot early
another slower ball, Mortaza picks him and plays him like he would a spinner. Down on a knee to sweep him between deep midwicket and deep square leg. That brings their first 300 against India
regulation pace, and Mortaza has picked it again. He makes room, gets under a length ball and swipes it to beat deep midwicket. Crucial runs. Is Kohli going to rue it?
so Sharma does what Yadav has been doing. Digs one in short, the ball gets head high, Mortaza is not in control of it, and offers R Sharma  catch at mid-on

loud, unending appeal. Lovely first ball. Swings back in, is hitting leg, but there is a small matter of an inside edge onto the pad. Lovely start for the debutant. Good call by the umpire. The crowd is abuzz
and with that ball coming in, it has put doubt in Sharma's mind. This one goes with the angle, Sharma plays at it, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, angling away, left alone
on a length, on off, defended with an open face to cover
short of a length, angling across, defended with an open face
Sharma breaks the maiden with a push that is straight of mid-off and allows them to take the single
starts with five wides. A quick delivery but down the leg side

another huge appeal. The whole stadium goes up. For a catch at the wicket this time. On a length, heavy ball. Comes back in from outside off, Sharma plays at it, the ball doesn't come back in as much as expected. It beats the outside edge. No bat involved
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
another appeal for lbw. This is exciting stuff but all the appeals have been optimistic. This one jags back in from short of a length, but is carrying over the stumps
nicely punched in front of third man but Tamim's sliding save draws a huge cheer from the crowd
quick length ball, middle and off, seams away, left alone. Bowled at 139ks. Generally bowling as quick as anybody has today
more pace. Short of a length, middle and leg, fizzes away. Left alone again
short of a length, punched towards mid-on, an overthrow concedes a second
on a length, on off, angling across, defended to point
short of a length, just outside off, steered to third man for one

another huge shout for lbw. The closest of them all so far. This is an offcutter. Nips back in from just short of a length and from just outside off. Beats the inside edge, hits him in front. Only slightly over the stumps. The bounce saves him
on a length, holds its line, takes a thick outside edge for one to third man

another cutter. This guy likes the cutter. Draws spongy bounce and away movement. Sharma chases it. Nearly edges it. Superb start by Bangladesh. Suddenly there is something in it for the bowlers? No, Bangladesh bowlers have bowled better
good carry from short of a length. Bowled at 135ks, left alone, Rahim collects it head high
Dhawan has been leaving him alone, but he has finally drawn  a loose shot. Short of a length, wide, at 139ks, Dhawan cuts without moving his feet and is beaten by the extra bounce
drives at a length ball, 140ks, gets a thick edge that falls short of third man
loose loose shot. Pressure showing on these eopeners. Too many errors of judgement. Short of a length, widish, he looks to cut, and is beaten by the 140ks pace here. Just late into the cut
short, wide, flays away at it, gets a thick edge for a one-bounce single to third man
lovely shot. That has silenced the crowd a little. On a length, angling away from off, and he check-drives on the up. All along the ground, between mid-off and cover
short of a length, middle and leg, angling away, takes a soft outside edge that falls short of second slip. Soft hands there

slight swing back in, pushed wide of mid-on, but Tamim has cost them four runs in excitement. Sharma is well in but he throws at it, and the ball ricochets off Sharma's bat for overthrows. To give India their due, neither batsman wanted to run an overthrow, but they can't say no to boundary overthrows
no luck there for Bangladesh. Dhawan steps out, Rahman bowls short of a length, gets the ball to nip back in, cuts him in two, but it beats the bat, stumps and the keeper for four byes
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover for one
short of a length, just outside off, defended to point

on a length, pushed with safe hands towards mid-off, comes through for one. A bit of a collision between Sharma and the bowler. It seems he has had a look from the corner of the eye where the batsman is running and then moved in his way. Sharma lets him know that, fingers are pointed, and it seems an apology has been rendered
short of a length, defended
defended with soft hands towards mid-on for one
beats him with a length ball that angles across him
leaves the crease, Mortaza pulls the length back a little. Dhawan drops it towards cover for a single

short of a length, no room, pushed towards mid-on. No single but Mortaza nearly collides with Dhawan as he rushes across to prevent the single. There is no bad blood here because this is all innocent. Mortaza apologises, and Dhawan accepts
short of a length, no room, defended
Sharma pulls this away disdainfully. Short ball, not much pace, hip high, and he plays the pick-up pull over square leg
edgy and uppish. A length ball that draws him forward but doesn't quite come on, and runs off the outside half of the bat between point and cover-point
on a length, middle and off, nicely defended off the front foot
beau-ti-ful. Elegant. A length ball on off, going across with the angle, he stands tall and drives this on the up. All along the ground, beats short cover and extra cover
short of a length, just outside off, slower ball, left alone
short of a length, wide, runs this down to third man for one
left alone outside off, bounces twice before reaching the keeper. Bowled at 125kmph. And not a slower ball
defends a length ball outside off with an open face
lovely shot again. Drives on the up, just a push, between mid-off and the bowler. Along the ground again
short of a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, Dhawan pushes at it, gets an inside edge
length ball, angling in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
another lovely shout. The stadium is absolutely quiet now. Can hear a pin drop. Dhawan dances down the the wicket and just pushes at it, but he has placed it between the bowler and mid-off
short of a length, 131ks, defended off the back foot
top-edges the pull. Goes ahead with it even off the front foot, but the top edge clears midwicket
in full control of that. This bouncer is chest high and slower than the previous. Easier to put it away. Over square leg
short of a length, just outside off, runs it down to third man

dropped? Or did he not even get a hand to it? Short of a length middle and off, seams away, Dhawan opens the face, edges it, to the left of Rahim. Low too. He reaches it with the dive, goes one-handed, and deflects it to third man for four
defended with an open face off the front foot
short of a length, short-arms it with his front leg in the air, gets a single to deep square

what an umpiring decision. He has given him out caught even before the catch is taken. And Rahim has dropped two in two overs. Poor spirit of cricket shown by the fielders here. First there is an inside edge involved here, and Rahim drops it. Tucker thinks it is taken, raises his finger, Dhawan begins to walk, and they try to run him out. They appeal too. Poor form. You can't run a batsman out when he has been given out mistakenly and is walking off
defended towards point
another defensive shot off the front foot
tucked away off the hip
short of a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
length ball, angling in, worked to leg for one
short of a length, no room, defended off the back foot
short of a length, tucks him up, no room. Defended
on a length, middle and leg, pushed for an easy single
short of a length, Dhawan leaves his crease, defends this to cover
tucked away off the pads to fine leg for one
wide length ball, runs this down to third man for one
short of a length, doesn't come on after pitching, stays a touch low, punched to mid-on
on a length, pushed to mid-off for one
wide length ball, driven to deep cover
flighted on middle and leg, worked away for one
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
tossed up, middle and off, defended
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg
down the wicket, pushed back to Hossain
down the wicket again to whip this to deep square leg
short of a length, just outside off, punched to third man for one
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to cover
short of a length, angling in, pushed into the leg side
makes room, Rubel bowls short and follows him, but he manages a single with the pull
steers this to third man for a single
pushes this offbreak to midwicket
pushes this down the ground but can't beat short straight midwicket
down the wicket, not to its pitch, but manages to chip it over midwicket to bring up the fifty. He raises his bat, and the stands are so quiet you can hear the arm move
reverse-sweeps this for one
length ball, middle and leg, swept away to deep square leg
lovely chip shot after dancing down the wicket to send this offbreak over extra cover for four
short of a length, outside off, opens the face, guides it past slip and comes back for two
short ball, on off, he stands tall and pulls this wide of deep midwicket for two
on a length, holds its line, defended off the back foot
short of a length, wide, cut away to third man for one
bouncer, at his head, Dhawan shapes up to pull, but bails out at the last moment
finally they have caught one and Dhawan walks. He is looking to make room, Taskin remains short and follows him. Dhawan tries the upper cut, but has no space. The edge settles with Rahim
Sharma meanwhile carries on along his merry ways. Rubel looks to bounce it, pulled away through square leg for four
short of a length, outside off, punched to third man for one
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-off
throat-high short ball, pulled away to square leg for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
pushes forward to defend this length ball outside off
full, outside off, driven to mid-off

Kohli has played a loose shot. That itch to feel bat on ball. The crowd has come alive. This is short of a length, wide, and Kohli just hangs his bat out. Even if he nails this nothing shot, he is not going to get a single off this. Which makes it an ordinary shot. And he has edged it. The roof comes off the stadium again, and game is on again. This is proving to be a superb ODI with all the twists and turns
length ball outside off, 137ks, left alone
full and wide, nearly a yorker, left alone
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
wicket-maiden. A length ball just outside off, at 135ks. Left alone
he looks for singles. Short of a length, outside off, he drops this at his feet and sets off for an easy single
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
fuller, Rahane stays back and defends. Rubel is now backing up Taskin's over unlike his previous over that contained an easy boundary
bouncer, well outside off, left alone

short of a length, angling in, punched back down the ground, Rubel dives to his right in his follow-through. That brings about another cheer. In the stands they are hanging on to their every move. Imagine the celebrations if they pull off a win tonight
full outside off, driven nicely but straight to mid-off
short of a length, widish, left alone
wide length ball, left alone. Sharma showing the caution to go with the match situation
short of a length, angling in, drops this towards midwicket, and comes through for one
wide half-volley, Rahane reaches out, drives, but sends it straight to point. The crowd goes up for a crowd catch
Rahane is off the mark. Punches this shortish ball to deep cover
break in Sharma's concentration too. Short and wide, he looks to cut without moving closer to the line of it. Beaten
on a length, middle and leg, angling towards off, defended to leg
on a length, just outside off, pushed on the up, straight to mid-off
there goes the cutter, sits the in the surface, comes on slowly, and Rahane has to defend even though this is pitched short
yorker, just outside off, he digs it out towards short cover, and Rohit calls him through for a single

what a big first wicket for Mustafizur. Twenty-five thousand in the stands scream their lungs out. They have gone mad. Bangladesh are on top. Lovely bowling. It's the cutter that has done it. Rohit fails to pick it, looks to work a fullish ball to leg, gets a massive leading edge that settles with Mortaza at mid-off
full and straight, angling in to off, defended by Raina
short of a length, just outside off, defended
stays in that channel. No easy runs. Defends with an open face. Oh that buzz in the stands. Like a wave going through them again and again
moves across to get inside its line, works it to leg for two
nice drive on the up, punchy, but can't beat the diving man at short cover
full ball, driven back down the ground, and straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end. That saves four runs, and the crowd loves it

this shot was a-comin'. Too many dot balls under Rahane's belt. He reaches out to this widish short ball. This is not cuttable length nor drivable. And it is just inside the tram line. Rahane reaches out, and is beaten by the extra bounce
slower ball, starts middle and leg, cuts away down the leg side for a wide
length ball, on up, pushed to mid-off. They will take a single off the overthrow. Unnecessary throw with both batsmen in the crease
short of a length, outside off, he uses his wrists to work this to leg for one
length ball, angling in, pushed straight of mid-on for one
short of a length, pitches outside leg, angles away towards off, stays a touch low, draws a defensive shot out of him
Rahane finally gets away. Gets a length ball outside off, and drives it on the up. All along the ground, through covers. Not a soul moves on the field, not a squeak from the crowd

lovely catch. Start the party already, Dhaka? Bangladesh get closer to a win? Another slower ball. He bowls a mean cutter. Rahane is early into it. Then to recover he turns the bat face early. The leading edge seams like it is sailing over his head but Nasir Hossain times his jump to perfection. Then he kicks the ball away. And 25000 celebrate with him
short of a length, angling, pushed between mid-off and cover for three
walks down first ball, works this length ball to leg for one
on a length, outside leg, easy single. He has actually placed it well, and they come back for two
punched back down the wicket, Taskin fields in the follow-through
bouncer, chest high, pulled away to long leg
looking to walk down again, but sees this ball is shortish, and stays back to push it to mid-on
on a length, on off, left alone

Mustafizur has a problem here. He has got a bit of a habit of getting into the way of the batsman. He looks at where the batsman is running, and then stands in the way. Dhoni runs into him. You don't want to run into Dhoni. He is a bull. Mustafizur has to go off the field so hard is the collision. Almost as if Dhoni has shoved him out of the way. And immediately looks at the umpire to suggest the bowler has deliberately come in his way
pushed towards cover for one
short of a length, punched to long-on for one
short, angling in, punched to cover
length ball, holds its line in front of leg, defended back
flighted on middle and leg, shimmies down to push this to long-on for one
tossed up again, pushed for a single. Bangladesh need to watch out against these easy singles. The absence of these is what brought them the last three wickets

lovely sharp catch, and Mushfiq gets in Dhoni's face. This is not a pleasant match, but Bangladesh are playing superbly. There is a previous to this aggressive celebration. Not long ago Dhoni collided with a debutant to send him off the field. Now Shakib draws the edge, quite a thick one as the ball dips and then turns away. Mushfiq takes a lovely catch, letting the ball turn and deflect and taking it almost behind his body, and then screams in Dhoni's face
flattish delivery, defended
flighted on off, driven to long-on
short of a length, flat, pushed to midwicket
flat, short of a length, into the body, hits him on the pad
short of a length, into the body, worked to leg for one
offbreak outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
leaves this offbreak alone outside off
angling into the pads, helped away to leg
push-drives this past point
flighted around off, dips on him, dug out to cover
length ball, into the pads, pushed to leg
sweeps from in front of the stumps, finds short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-on
down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, gets a single
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
short of a length, into the pads, punched to long-on
into the pads again, whipped fine, but can;t beat short fine leg
short, not too wide, punched away to deep cover
stays back to punch this length-ball offbreak but straight to cover
tossed up, on off, driven to long-off
punches this shortish delivery to long-on
slow through the air, on a length, around off, turning in, defended back to him
flat, middle and leg, shovelled to short fine leg
slower through the air, pushed to short straight midwicket
flatter. Just a subtle change in trajectory. Punched back to him
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-on
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, angling in, no turn, pushed into the leg side for one
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
flighted on off, defended off the front foot
length ball, angling in, defended off the front foot again
flat ball, punched down to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
flat, down the leg side, swept away fine for one
and this seems to be the message: don't let the spinners bowl in rhythm, don't let the asking rate go out of hand. He jumps out of the crease and slugs this over wide long-on for a six
gets down on a knee, and pull-sweeps this to fine leg for one
tossed up, dipping, dug out for a single to long-on
on a length, on off, defended
looks to sweep, is beaten, the ball rolls off the pad towards short fine, and Jadeja sneaks in a single
calculated risk. The mid-on is up, and Raina dances down the wicket to loft this even when unbalanced over mid-on for four
on a length, angling in, pushed to cover
stays back to push a length ball to deep cover for one
cramps him up by following him as he makes room. Jadeja manages to flick it wide of deep midwicket for two
flat delivery angling in, Jadeja looks to dab at it, gets a bottom edge that is safe
flat length ball, defended to cover
short of a length, sticks in the pitch, Raina has to wait and wait for the ball to arrive and can only defend it to leg
short of a length, angling across, Raina gets a bottom edge on the push for a single
short of a length, on the pads, turned to midwicket for a dot
length ball, pushed to mid-off with soft hands for one
on a length, on the pads, worked away for one to square leg
slower ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off, and they take a second off the overthrow
short of a length, widish, and Jadeja has punched this past point for four. India staying alive. Just
full ball angling in, whipped away past the diving man at mid-on. This is a slow dive. London Bridge-like. And it's Mustafizur
long hop, pulled away, but he has hit this straight to midwicket
on a length, angling away from middle and leg, looks to defend, gets a single off the inside half of the bat
punched on the up, powerfully hit, but straight to mid-off
short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
short of a length, just outside off, looks to cut it, but can't beat the man at point
slower ball, short of a length, wide, cut away to deep cover
dug in short, comes off slowly off the pitch, pushed to long-on, wants a second but Sarkar charges in to keep them down to one
pulled away wide of long-on, Sarkar puts in a diving save to keep them down to two
length ball, slower, at 111ks, defended with an open face to point
what a shot to welcome the young man back. That's a Raina special. He makes room, gets under a length ball, and drives it inside-out over cover for a six. The crowd has gone quiet again
short of a length, into the rib, bunted into the leg side for one
short of a length, just outside off, Jadeja looks to run this down to third man, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and they steal a single

what a cutter. Mustafizur has his own back. He bowls a mean cutter. It is not easy to pick. Raina is totally deceived by the lack of pace on it. Looks to drive at it away from the body as it pitches on a length outside off. Too early into the shot, and then the ball cuts back in to take the inside edge onto the stumps. Mustafizur is pumped

and out goes Ashwin. Mustafizur is on a hat-trick. Lovely cutter again. He changes the grip at the last possible moment. Later than usual. And the pace dip is not too big. In fact the pace on this slower delivery is enough for a faint edge to carry through to the keeper on a subcontinent pitch. This one pitches on a length, on off, and cuts away to kiss Ashwin's bat
full outside off, driven along the ground. The crowd is disappointed but only momentarily. This will be one long night of celebration. They are sure to fell India now
bouncer. Gets it head high. Kumar doesn't know much about it. He just fends. Lucky that it has not lobbed up
short of a length, seams in, defended towards leg
short of a length, outside off, punched away towards deep cover for three
slower ball, 108ks, on a length, middle and leg, drops it at his feet for a single
short ball, head high, pulled away to deep midwicket
slower ball again, Jadeja uses all the power in his wrists to push it wide of point for one
missed out. A full toss just outside off, driven straight to mid-off

five-for on debut. They are all on his back. They love him. Bangladesh loves him. Mustafizur has run through India with his cutter. It does it once again. Jadeja knows he has to do something. No point playing for a not-out. He looks to hit a six because the asking rate has gone too far, and is undone by the slower ball. Holes out to long-on. Start the party, Dhaka
short of a length, angling away, beats him
another cutter, draws the edge here, but M Sharma is not playing a forceful shot so the edge falls short
short of a length, the cutter, only slightly slower, 126ks, beats the edge after squaring him up
that cutter is cutting through India. Nearly another wicket. This pitches just outside leg and breaks away to beat the outside edge. He looks like taking a wicket every ball now
short of a length, just outside off, pushed past cover for one
flat, into the pads, beats the inside edge
flighted on off, driven back to him
tossed up outside of, really slow, left alone
worked to leg
flatter ball, looks to cut him, and is beaten
short of a length, on off, defended off the back foot
cutter again, sits up in the surface, short, and played back to him
Sharma tries to whack this back down the ground and is beaten by the cutter
another cutter, Sharma feels obliged to follow it as it breaks away after pitching short of a length. Beaten

he has dropped a sixth. This would have made him only the second man to take a six-for on debut. Short of a length, sits up again, looks to flick it, only succeeds in sending it back to Mustafizur who drops a sitter. But think of the five he took, not the one he didn't
Mustafizur's night ends with a boundary off the thick outside edge of Sharma's bat, but what a night it has been. Well played, young man: 9.2-1-50-5
KUmar jumps out of the crease to loft this down the ground, gets it straight of long-off where Talukdar, the substitute, dives but but can't hold on to the catch. A really really difficult chance
Shakib bowls this really slow, beats the edge as Kumar defends
slog sweep. He has nailed it. It flies over deep midwicket
pushed to long-on for one. Rahim shouts, "Game is not over yet." He wants this done before he lets the guard down
left alone outside off
really really slow and it turns past Sharma's bat
short of a length, angling in, hit down to long-on for one
top-edges a pull shot, and it falls short of deep midwicket
slower ball, this is easier to pick than Mustafizur's, and he has drilled it between mid-off and cover for four

and Bangladesh are a step closer. Mushfiqur has turned his own night around after dropping Dhawan twice. This is a slower ball from Mortaza, Sharma makes a bit of room to try to run this down to third man. The ball is slow, takes the edge, and Rahim dives to his right to take it one-handed. That's a fifth catch for Rahim
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
slow teasing delivery. He waits and waits and then defends
mis-hit towards long-on but it falls short
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
stays back to keep out a flat delivery
looks to sweep, finds square leg with it
tossed up outside off, left alone
bouncer, just outside off, he stays away from it
short of a length, outside off, runs to third man for one
bouncer, wide. Too high
slower ball, a nothing ball as it is easy to pick and Kumar makes room to sends it crashing over mid-off for four
full, angling in, he moves across to work this to leg
full, into the pads, defended to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, cut in front of square for one
on a length, on off, punched back to him
tossed up outside off, slow through the air, turns past the edge
stays back to punch this back to Shakib
flighted outside off, teasingly slow, left alone outside off

that's it. Shakib has provided the finishing touch with an lbw with an arm ball. Trapped in front. Cue big celebration. They have earned it, and deserved it. Mortaza calls Taskin for a chest bump to reprise the World Cup celebrations. And Mortaza performs a mock fall to reprise World Cup again
